title: Network Forensics for C2 Communication
description: An investigator must analyze a network packet capture (PCAP) file from a compromised host to identify the attacker's command-and-control (C2) channel.

tasks.description: Load the PCAP file into a network analysis tool like Wireshark.
tasks.expected_outcome: Investigator successfully loads the evidence file.

tasks.description: Filter the traffic to identify suspicious connections to external IP addresses over non-standard ports.
tasks.expected_outcome: Investigator isolates a long-running, encrypted connection to an unknown IP address over port 4444.

tasks.description: Identify the external IP address as the C2 server and extract it to be blocked at the firewall.
tasks.expected_outcome: Investigator successfully identifies the C2 infrastructure from the network traffic.
